title: Algal species in a flask of sterilized pond water

content.question:
Figure I shows the growth of an algal species in a flask of sterilized pond water. If phosphate is added as indicated, the growth curve changes as shown in Figure II.

Which of the following is the best prediction of the algal growth if nitrate is added instead of phosphate?

choices.label: A graph with the horizontal axis labeled time and the vertical axis labeled algae population. The growth curve starts at the intersection of the x and y axes and increases exponentially then flattens out halfway up the the vertical axis. Nitrate is added after the growth curve flattens out, then the curve increases exponentially again and flattens out at the top of the vertical axis.

A graph with the horizontal axis labeled time and the vertical axis labeled algae population. The growth curve starts at the intersection of the x and y axes and increases exponentially then flattens out halfway up the vertical axis. Nitrate is added after the growth curve flattens out, then the curve decreases exponentially and flattens out, creating a bell curve.

A graph with the horizontal axis labeled time and the vertical axis labeled algae population. The growth curve starts at the intersection of the x and y axes and increases exponentially then flattens out halfway up the vertical axis. Nitrate is added after the growth curve flattens out, creating no change in the growth curve, it continues horizontally at the same algae population level.

A graph with the horizontal axis labeled time and the vertical axis labeled algae population. The growth curve starts at the intersection of the x and y axes and increases exponentially then flattens out halfway up the vertical axis. Nitrate is added after the growth curve flattens out, then there is a sharp peak and then the algae population decreases rapidly.

content.answer: A graph with the horizontal axis labeled time and the vertical axis labeled algae population. The growth curve starts at the intersection of the x and y axes and increases exponentially then flattens out halfway up the vertical axis. Nitrate is added after the growth curve flattens out, creating no change in the growth curve, it continues horizontally at the same algae population level.
